required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 09, 2023
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Inpatient Endoscopy Procedure Planning Delays and Impact on Length of Stay and 30-day Readmission
clinical_study.official_title: Inpatient Endoscopy Procedure Planning Delays and Impact on Length of Stay and 30-day Readmission

brief_summary.textblock: Single center retrospective cohort study of all inpatient endoscopy procedures to asses factors associated with inpatient endoscopy delays and impact on length of stay and 30-day readmission

detailed_description.textblock:
Background: Delays in inpatient endoscopy planning negatively influence the quality and accessibility of care. This may result in higher healthcare costs, negative health outcomes, and unnecessary readmissions and use of hospital beds. Additionally, prolonged hospital stay is associated with poorer health outcomes and risk of nosocomial infections, amongst others.
Objective: To asses factors associated with inpatient endoscopy delays and impact on length of stay and 30-day readmission
Study design: Single center retrospective cohort study of all inpatient endoscopy procedures (gastroscopy, colonoscopy, ERCP, sigmoidoscopy) during 2016-2022. Data will be identified and extracted using CTCue. Only pseudonymized data will be used. Inpatient endoscopy delay will be defined as the number of days between the planned date versus the actual date. Multivariable logistic regression models will be performed to assess factors associated with inpatient endoscopy delay.

primary_outcome.description: IED will be defined as the number of days between the planned date versus the actual date.

primary_outcome.measure: Difference in type of endoscopic procedure between patients with and without IED
primary_outcome.description: Type of endoscopic procedure: gastroscopy/colonoscopy/endoscopic retrograde cholangio-pancreaticography (ERCP)

primary_outcome.measure: Difference in type of sedation between patients with and without IED
primary_outcome.description: Type of sedation during endoscopic procedure: No sedation/conscious sedation/general anesthesia

secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study cohort period from 1 january 2016 until 31 december 2022
secondary_outcome.description: length of hospital admission in days
percentage of readmissions within 30 days after initial discharge

secondary_outcome.measure: Odds ratio of presence of inpatient endoscopy delays for risk of prolonged length of hospital stay and 30-day readmissions
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from admission till 30 days after discharge
secondary_outcome.description: multivariable logistic regression modelling to assess factors associated with both outcomes and the impact of inpatient endoscopy delay

secondary_outcome.measure: Odds ratio of presence of inpatient endoscopy delays for risk of 30-day readmissions
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from admission till 30 days after discharge
secondary_outcome.description: multivariable logistic regression modelling to assess factors associated with both outcomes and the impact of inpatient endoscopy delay

intervention.description: all inpatient endoscopy procedures (gastroscopy, colonoscopy, ERCP, sigmoidoscopy) during 2016-2022.

study_pop.textblock: Adult inpatients from all hospital departments undergoing endoscopy procedures. Patients will be selected via CTCue, with an admission based query that selects all adult patients with an admission of at least two days between 1-1-2014 and 1-12-2022 AND an endoscopic care activity.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adult patients (>18 years)
- Clinical admission in any hospital department of at least two days during 1 January 2016 and 1 December 2022
- Endoscopic procedure during clinical admission, including gastroscopy, endoscopic retrograde cholangiopancreatography (ERCP), endoscopic ultrasound (EUS), flexible sigmoidoscopy, colonoscopy
Exclusion Criteria:
- Elective admission
- Procedure only for insertion of nasogastric or nasojejunal (feeding) tube without any other diagnostic or therapeutic aims

patient_data.ipd_description: IPD will be shared upon reasonable request
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: supporting information will be shared upon reasonable request
